column4: question about xorg, I have multiple device, monitor, and screen sections setup for my two monitors, my computer monitor and my television.  the television is screen 1, and computer monitor is screen 0.  if I setup a server layout for just the television, should "startx -- -layout TVOnly" not start xorg only upon the television?  TVOnly would be the identifier of the server layout for just the tv.
most likely, yes
were there any specific things you had to do?  unusual settings maybe?
what kind of gfx card?  ati or nvidia?
I have two more layouts, one for monitor only and one for tv and monitor and both work.  I have an nvidia card.
the TVOnly layout is the only one giving me trouble...  :-)
i know exactly what you mean.
i looked in the nvidia docs and eventually figured it out, let me see here, though.
would you mind possible pastebinning your xorg.conf for me?  I can compare it to mine and see if I see any major differences
- i assume you're using s-video, for "TVOutFormat", do you have "SVIDEO" or "S-VIDEO"?
I have S-Video
change it to "SVIDEO" without a dash
I'll try that, but I think I've tried it before. I'll brb, gonna see if it works.
k, i think it was something wierd like that
there was no change, I got the same error
i forget what eventually got it to work.  i'll email my xorg.conf if you like
could you pastebin it?
yeah gimme a sec
I appreciate it, very much.  :-)
http://pastebin.com/843907
after comparing my xorg.conf to yours, I have been unable to solve the problem.  Would you be able to link me to the NVIDIA documentation you used?  Maybe I can figure it out from those.
